findings.title: Cross Site Scripting (Reflected) - XSS
findings.description:
Cross-site Scripting (XSS) vulnerability found. Attacker-supplied code can be echoed into a user's browser.

URL: http://vulnerable-app:3000/search?q=<script>alert(1)</script>
Parameter: q
Attack: <script>alert(1)</script>

CWE-79
findings.mitigation: Use a vetted library or framework that does not allow this weakness. Encode all user input before rendering.

findings.title: SQL Injection vulnerability
findings.description:
SQL injection may be possible. The 'id' parameter appears to be vulnerable to SQL injection attacks.

URL: http://vulnerable-app:3000/api/users?id=1' OR '1'='1
Parameter: id
Evidence: SQL syntax error

CWE-89
findings.mitigation: Do not trust client side input. Use parameterized queries or prepared statements.

findings.title: Missing Anti-clickjacking Header
findings.description:
The response does not include Content-Security-Policy with 'frame-ancestors' directive or X-Frame-Options header to protect against ClickJacking attacks.

Affected URLs:
- http://vulnerable-app:3000/
- http://vulnerable-app:3000/login

CWE-1021
findings.mitigation: Set X-Frame-Options header to 'DENY' or 'SAMEORIGIN', or use Content-Security-Policy with frame-ancestors directive.

findings.title: Web Browser XSS Protection Not Enabled
findings.description:
Web Browser XSS Protection is not enabled. The X-XSS-Protection HTTP response header is not set on the web server.

URL: http://vulnerable-app:3000/

CWE-693
findings.mitigation: Set the X-XSS-Protection HTTP response header to '1; mode=block'.

findings.title: Strict-Transport-Security Header Not Set
findings.description:
HTTP Strict Transport Security (HSTS) header is not set. This allows attackers to perform man-in-the-middle attacks.

URL: http://vulnerable-app:3000/

CWE-319
findings.mitigation: Configure your web server to send the Strict-Transport-Security header with an appropriate max-age value.

findings.title: X-Content-Type-Options Header Missing
findings.description:
The Anti-MIME-Sniffing header X-Content-Type-Options was not set to 'nosniff'. This could allow MIME type sniffing attacks.

URL: http://vulnerable-app:3000/

CWE-693
findings.mitigation: Set the X-Content-Type-Options header to 'nosniff' for all web pages.
